oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Effect of crop species and management practices on perennial weeds in organic farming
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Vanhala, Petri
Lötjönen, Timo
Salonen, Jukka
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Weed management
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In order to study the biology and non-chemical control of perennial weeds, a three-year field experiment was established in 2001 at Vihti, southern Finland. The experiment was placed in a clay soil field under organic production, infested moderately with Cirsium arvense, Elymus repens and Stachys palustris, and heavily with Sonchus arvensis.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Vanhala, Petri; Lötjönen, Timo and Salonen, Jukka (2003) Effect of crop species and management practices on perennial weeds in organic farming. Paper at: NJF's 22nd congress "Nordic agriculture in global perspective", Turku, Finland, July 1-4, 2003.
